main event: A round white object was observed in Bloomington, Illinois, for about 30 minutes on 1-2 September 1963.
interesting points: The object was initially seen at a 45-degree elevation moving from South to Northwest before disappearing at a 25-degree elevation., The observation lasted for approximately 30 minutes, with the object visible for an additional 15 minutes., The observer is identified as a housewife with a reliability estimated as very good., The reported object was described as unusually large and bright., The sighting occurred under calm and cloudy conditions with some distant lightning.
